questions.Question: Article 359 of the Constitution authorizes the president of India to suspend the right to move any court for the enforcement of Fundamental Rights during :
questions.optionB: A failure of constitutional machinery in States
questions.solution: Solution:		Where a Proclamation of Emergency is in operation, the President may by order declare that the right to move any court for the enforcement of such of 1[the rights conferred by Part III (except articles 20 and 21)] as may be mentioned in the order and all proceedings pending in any court for the enforcement of the rights so mentioned shall remain suspended for the period during which the Proclamation is in force or for such shorter period as may be specified in the order.

questions.Question: The correct chronological order of the formation of Haryana, Sikkim, Arunanchal Pradesh and Nagaland as full states of Indian Union is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Nagaland on 1st December 1963. Haryana on 1st November 1966. Sikkim on 16th May 1975. Arunachal Pradesh on 20th Feb 1987.

questions.Question: The speaker of the Lok Sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. This phenomenon is known as :
questions.solution: Solution:Yielding the floor. The speaker of the Lok sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. Crossing the floor: Passing between the member addressing the House and the Chair which is considered breach of Parliamentary etiquette. Point of Order: A Member of Parliament may raise a point of order if he feels that the proceedings of' the House do not follow the normal rules. The presiding officer decides whether the point of order raised by the member should be allowed. Calling Attention Motion: With the prior permission of the Speaker, any member of the Parliament may call the attention of a Minister to a matter of urgent public importance. The Minister may make a brief statement about the matter or he may ask for time to make a statement later.

questions.Question: By which Constitutional Amendment Act was the number of Lok sabha seats increased from 525 to 545 ?
questions.solution: Solution:		31st Constitutional Amendment Act, 1973 - By this amendment the seats of Lok Sabha was increased from 525 to 545 but reduced the representatior of UT's in Lok Sabha from 25 to 20.

questions.Question: The first Backward Class commission was appointed in 1953 under the chairmanship of :
questions.solution: Solution:Kaka Kalelkar Commission:The Backward Class Commission was appointed in 1953 with Kaka Kalelkar as the Chairman. The Commission was asked to determine the criteria to be adopted to provide concessions to “socially and educationally backward classes” besides the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes; the Commission was also asked to prepare a list of such classes.

questions.Question: The first - ever Indian Railways Human Resources Round Table Conference has started in which city?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Union Minister of Railways Suresh Prabhakar Prabhu has inaugurated the first-ever Indian Railways Human Resources Round Table Conference in New Delhi on June 10, 2017.

questions.Question: Kacheguda railway station has declared the India’s first Energy - Efficient ‘A1 Category’ Railway Station. It is situated in which city?
questions.solution: Solution:		Hyderabad's Kacheguda railway station becomes the first energy efficient station in India. The Kacheguda railway station in Hyderabad, Telangana, has been declared as the first energy-efficient railway station in the country, which now also falls under the A1 category.

questions.Question: India’s first - ever railways disaster management centre will come up in which city?
questions.solution: Solution:		India's first-ever railways disaster management centre is expected to come up near Bengaluru, Karnataka by 2018 and will be used to replicate train accidents to improve rescue operation efforts.

questions.Question: The Ministry of Railways has signed MoU with which Union Ministry to augment services in Railway hospitals?
questions.optionA: Ministry of Women and Child Development
questions.optionB: Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation
questions.optionC: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
questions.solution: Solution:		A Memorandum of Understanding was signed between Ministry of Railways and Ministry of AYUSH in New Delhi today to augment the AYUSH system services in its zonal hospitals at New Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai and Guwahati.

questions.Question: Which road suburban railway station in Mumbai has been rechristened as Prabhadevi station?
questions.solution: Solution:		The name of Elphinstone Road railway station officially changed to Prabhadevi from July 19, 2018.

questions.Question: Indian Railways is constructing the country’s longest railway tunnel and tallest bridge in which of the following states?
questions.solution: Solution:		The longest of these tunnels will be 11.55 km long, making it India's longest tunnel under construction. Also, India will soon boast the world's tallest railway bridge, construction of which is on in full swing, over the river Chenab in the hostile terrain of Jammu and Kashmir.

questions.Question: General Manager is responsible for
questions.optionC: Both railway Board and Railway Ministry
questions.solution: Solution:		General Manager is responsible for Railway Board.

questions.Question: Over which of the following rivers is the world's highest railway bridge in Kashmir being constructed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Chenab Bridge is an Indian railway steel and concrete arch bridge under construction between Bakkal and Kauri in the Reasi district of Jammu and Kashmir in India. When completed, the bridge will span the Chenab River at a height of 359 m (1,178 ft) above the river, making it the world's highest rail bridge.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements: 1. Anti - collision device (ACD) Network is patented by Konkan Railway Corporation Ltd. 2. Anti - collision device (ACD) uses Global Positioning System for its work Which among the above statements is / are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		Anti - collision device (ACD) Network is patented by Konkan Railway Corporation Ltd. and Anti - collision device (ACD) uses Global Positioning System for its work.

questions.Question: In recent times, the “dynamic brake system” is becoming popular in modern railways. The dynamic brake system coverts Kinetic energy to________:
questions.solution: Solution:		The dynamic brake system coverts Kinetic energy to electricity.

questions.Question: Read the Following Railway Headquarters and Identify which is False?
questions.solution: Solution:		Central railway - Bhopal is wrong because central railway has its headquarters in Mumbai.

questions.Question: In which of the following cities are located 3 zonal headquarters of Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kolkata gets the trophy for having 3 Zonal Headquarters of Indian Railways.

questions.Question: Which of the following zonal headquarters - city combination is incorrect?
questions.solution: Solution:		North Western - Jodhpur is incorrect.

questions.Question: The headquarters of South Railways is situated at
questions.solution: Solution:		Southern Railway has its headquarters in Chennai.

questions.Question: The headquarters of South - Central Railways is situated at
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of South - Central Railways is situated at Secunderabad.

questions.Question: Cancellation facility through ________ helpline number will be provided using 'One Time Password' sent on registered phone number.
questions.solution: Solution:		Cancellation facility through 139 helpline number will be provided using 'One Time Password' sent on registered phone number.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements with regard to ‘Ad Hoc’ Committees of the parliament:1)They are temporary in nature and appointed for a specific purpose2)Railway Convention Committee is an ad hoc committeeWhich among the above statements is / are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		They are temporary in nature and appointed for a specific purpose and Railway Convention Committee is an ad hoc committee.

questions.Question: The Indian Railways has launched which virtual server to optimise server usage and faster connectivity?
questions.solution: Solution:		 In a significant IT initiative, the Railways launched RailCloud - a virtual server with an inbuilt security system to optimise server usage and faster connectivity.

questions.Question: The passenger bogies of the Indian Railways are manufactured at which of the following places?
questions.solution: Solution:		The passenger bogies of the Indian Railways are manufactured at Perambur.

questions.Question: Gorakhpur which has the longest railway platform in the world is located in which of the following states?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Gorakhpur Railway Station is located in the city of Gorakhpur in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It has the world's longest railway platform. It serves as the headquarters of the North Eastern Railway.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements with respect to the Railway Convention Committee:1)The committee consists of members only from Lok Sabha2)Railway Minister is the ex - officio chairman of Railway Convention CommitteeWhich of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		Neither 1 nor 2

questions.Question: With respect to ‘Operating ratio’ in Railways, which of the following statement is/are correct?1)The higher is the ‘Operating Ratio’; the better is the economic condition of railways.2) ‘Operating ratio’ of Indian Railways is high on account of social service obligation imposed in Budget.Select the correct option from the codes given below
questions.solution: Solution:		'Operating ratio’ of Indian Railways is high on account of social service obligation imposed in Budget.

questions.Question: New Humsafar Express, 3 - tier AC train was flagged off between which two locations on 2 June 2018?
questions.solution: Solution:		New Humsafar Express Flagged Off between Jodhpur and Bandra. Union Railway Minister, Piyush Goyal flagged off a new Humsafar Jodhpur Bandra Express. The train started its journey towards Bandra from Bhagat Ki Kothi Railway station in Rajasthan's Jodhpur on 2nd June 2018.

questions.Question: Which is the India's first double Decker train?
questions.optionA: Ahmedabad - Mumbai Central Double Decker Express
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: TCAS full form is:
questions.solution: Solution:		Traffic Collision Avoidance System.

questions.Question: What is the length of North - Eastern Frontier Railway (NEFR)?
questions.solution: Solution:		The length of North - Eastern Frontier Railway (NEFR) is 3700 Km.

questions.Question: Who invented the railway engine?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1825 George Stephenson built the Locomotion for the Stockton and Darlington Railway. This was the first public steam railway in the world and then in 1829, he built The Rocket which was entered in and won the Rainhill Trials.

questions.Question: How many members did the railway board had?
questions.solution: Solution:		Railway board had 4 members.

questions.Question: The main objective of British developing Indian Railway system was to facilitate the traffic between?
questions.optionA: Source of raw material and export centers
questions.optionB: Source of raw material and ports
questions.optionC: Source of raw material and production centers
questions.optionD: Source of raw material and markets
questions.solution: Solution:		The main objective of British developing Indian Railway system was to facilitate the traffic between source of raw material and production centers.

questions.Question: ________ percent sub - quota for women under all reserved categories
questions.solution: Solution:		Railways has introduced 33% of sub-quota for women in the allotment of food stalls at rail premises as a special provision in the new catering policy.

questions.Question: Which is the fastest train in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		The fastest train in India is Tejas Express.

questions.Question: Which state has the longest route (in kilometers) of railway line in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, the largest route kilometers are in Uttar Pradesh with 8726 kilometers.

questions.Question: As per the recent survey conducted by the Quality Council of India, which railway stations have been named as the cleanest and dirtiest railway stations in India?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Which Zone is the largest railway zone in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Northern Railway zone is the Answer. Its headquarter is New Delhi Railway Station. Northern Railways is one of nine old zones of Indian Railways and also the biggest in terms of network having 6807 kilometre route.

questions.Question: In which country was flange wheel invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Flange wheel was invented in Germany.

questions.Question: Metro Railway is functioning in which of the following Indian States?
questions.solution: Solution:		Metro Railway is functioning in West Bengal.

questions.Question: The first locomotive which was manufactured in Chittaranjan on
questions.solution: Solution:		On 1 November, 1950, Indian President Dr. Rajendra Prasad formally dedicated the first steam rail-engine produced by the company (a WG class locomotive bearing the registration number 8401) to the freedom fighter Deshbandhu Chittranjan Das.

questions.Question: Introduced ________ in Konkan Railway to help old and disabled passengers.
questions.solution: Solution:		Sarathi Seva

questions.Question: When was the new Harbour rail line inaugurated?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Harbour line is a branch line of the Mumbai Suburban Railway operated by Central Railway. It was named so because it catered to the eastern neighbourhoods along the city's natural harbour. Its termini are Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT), Andheri/Goregaon and Panvel on the CSMT-Goregaon, CSMT-Panvel and Panvel-Andheri routes. The first section of the line, between Kurla and Reay Road, opened on 12 December 1910. In 1925, the line was connected to the then Victoria Terminus via an elevated rail corridor between Dockyard Road and Sandhurst Road.

questions.Question: In which year palace on wheels train inaugurated?
questions.solution: Solution:		With a noble motive to promote tourism in Rajasthan, the Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation along with Indian Railway launched the first Indian luxury train Palace on Wheels on 26th January' 1982.

questions.Question: Where did Chapman form the committee?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The Maitree Express connects India with which of the following countries?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Maitree Express or Dhaka-Kolkata Express is an International passenger train serving the railway connecting the Bangladeshi capital of Dhaka and India's West Bengal (Paschim Banga) states capital Kolkata. This is the only railway link between the cities of the two nations.

questions.Question: Fairy Queen, the world's oldest steam locomotive in regular operation, plies between New Delhi and ________
questions.solution: Solution:		It occasionally runs between New Delhi and Alwar. In 1998 it was listed in the Guinness Book of Records as the world's oldest steam locomotive in regular service. The Fairy Queen runs on the same route as the Palace on Wheels, the tourist train launched in 1982, and in 1999 was awarded a National Tourism Award.

questions.Question: Who will be called Sahayak?
questions.optionB: Upcoming Event made for Disabled Persons
questions.solution: Solution:		Coolies will be called sahayaks.

questions.Question: Mission PACE deals with
questions.solution: Solution:		Mission PACE (Procurement and Consumption Efficiency): This mission aims to improve our procurement and consumption practices to improve the quality of goods and services.

questions.Question: Which state government has recently signed MoU with Indian Railways to expand green cover?
questions.solution: Solution:		In a bid to expand the green cover, the Maharashtra government recently signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Indian Railways, under which trees will be planted on the land adjacent to the railway tracks in the state.

questions.Question: Which research arm of Indian Railways has launched “New Online Vendor Registration System”?
questions.optionA: Indian Railway Institute of Signal Engineering and Telecommunication
questions.optionD: Indian Railway Service of Electrical Engineers
questions.solution: Solution:		Research Designs and Standards Organisation has launched “New Online Vendor Registration System".

questions.Question: Who of the following was the first Railway Minister of independent India?
questions.solution: Solution:		John Mathai was the first Railway Minister of independent India.

questions.Question: The largest national enterprise of India is
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railway is the largest national enterprise of India.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements about Operating Ratio in Indian Railways:1)The higher the operating ratio of Indian Railways the better is the condition of Indian Railways. 2)Operating ratio of Indian Railways is high on account of social service obligation imposed in Budget.Which of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		Operating ratio of Indian Railways is high on account of social service obligation imposed in Budget.

questions.Question: The Speaker of Lok Sabha also works as the ex - officio Chairperson of which of the following committees?1)Railway Convention Committee2)Business Advisory Committee3)Public Account CommitteeSelect the correct option from the codes given below:

questions.Question: Which of the following faunal species found in India are invasive species?1)Railway Creeper2)Lantana3)Black wattleSelect the correct option from the codes given below:

questions.Question: Which among the following becomes the part of Consolidated Fund of India?1)Capitation Taxes2)Taxes on railway fares and freights3)Taxes on sale and purchase of newspapers and advertisements thereinSelect the correct option from the codes given below:

questions.Question: Which of the following is / are eligible to receive Ways and Means Advances from RBI to handle their temporary mismatch in the cash flow?1)State Governments2)Central Government3)Public Sector Companies4)Indian RailwaysSelect the correct option from the codes given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		State governments

questions.Question: The headquarters of North - Eastern railway is situated at
questions.solution: Solution:		The North Eastern Railway is one of the 18 railway zones in India. It is headquartered at Gorakhpur and comprises Lucknow, Varanasi and Izzatnagar or Bareilly division.

questions.Question: The headquarters of Northern Railway is at
questions.solution: Solution:		The Northern Railway (abbreviated NR and उरे) is one of the 18 Railway zones of India and the northernmost zone of the Indian Railways. Its headquarter is New Delhi Baroda House near India Gate.

questions.Question: Consider the following railway zones with their headquarters:West Central Railway→ Jabalpur East Coast Railway → Bhubaneswar Western Railway→ MumbaiWhich of the above is / are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		All are correct.

questions.Question: The headquarters of the South Central Railway zone is located in?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of the South Central Railway zone is located in Secunderabad.

questions.Question: Consider the following:Road and Railways Schools Sanitary Facilities HospitalsWhich among the above are considered to be the Economic Overheads?
questions.solution: Solution:		Road and Railways are considered to be the Economic Overheads.

questions.Question: Which of the following sectors are included as part of multi - modal logistics hubs in India?1)Aviation2)National Highways3) Ports4)Inland waterways5)RailwaysSelect the correct option from codes given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above

questions.Question: Who has been appointed as the new Chairman of Railway Board?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vinod Kumar Yadav, the South Central Railway (SCR) general manager, has been appointed as Chairman of the Railway Board under the Ministry of Railways and ex-officio Principal Secretary to the Government of India. He succeeded Ashwani Lohani.

questions.Question: Rajasthan is under which of the following railway zones?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rajasthan is included under North-western Railway zone which is one among the 17 railway zones of India. Its headquarter is at Jaipur. It comprises of four divisions: Jodhpur, Bikaner, Jaipur and Ajmer divisions.

questions.Question: Indian Railways has recently signed pact with which company for use of Natural Gas in railway workshops?
questions.solution: Solution:		In New Delhi, Indian Railways has recently signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with GAIL India Ltd for use of environment-friendly fuel 'Natural Gas' in Railway workshops and production units.

questions.Question: Besides Maharashtra, Karnataka and Goa, which of the following is the fourth State for Konakan Railway Project?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kerala is the fourth state.

questions.Question: The headquarters of North - East Frontier Railway (NFR) is
questions.solution: Solution:		The Northeast Frontier Railway (abbreviated NFR), is one of the 18 railway zones in India. Headquartered in Maligaon, Guwahati in the state of Assam, it is responsible for rail operations in the entire Northeast and parts of West Bengal and Bihar.

questions.Question: The Ministry of Railways has recently launched which app for freight managers?
questions.solution: Solution:		In a major digital initiative to help plan the traffic flows and optimize freight operations, Ministry of Railways has launched Smart Freight Operation Optimisation and Real Time Information (SFOORTI) App for freight managers.

questions.Question: Launched World's first Bio Toilet Train. Named as:
questions.solution: Solution:		Dirubharg Rajdhani Express is world's first Bio Toilet Train.

questions.Question: The Rangpo - Sivok Railway line, connects which among the following two states of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Rangpo - Sivok Railway line, connects Sikkim to West Bengal.

questions.Question: Matheran Hill Railway is located in which state of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Matheran is a hill station, near Mumbai, in the west Indian state of Maharashtra.

questions.Question: Consider the following initiative with Ministries associated to them:1)Project Swarna – Ministry of Railways2)Project CHAMAN – Ministry of Agriculture 3)Project DARPAN – Ministry of CommunicationsWhich of the above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		All three are correct.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements about the Bio Toilet Project in Indian Railways:1)The bio - toilets are joint initiative of Indian Railways and DRDO2)The human excreta in the bio - toilets is treated through anaerobic digestion process3)The bio toilet reduces the solid human waste to biogas and pure waterWhich of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		All three are correct.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements about the proposed Rail Development Authority:1)It will act within the parameters of the Railway Act, 19892)The authority will consist of four members3)It will regulate the sector opened to the private sector for investmentWhich of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		All three are correct.

questions.Question: When did the first ignition engine develop?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1879, Karl Benz patented a reliable two-stroke gas engine. In 1892, Rudolf Diesel developed the first compressed charge, compression ignition engine. In 1926, Robert Goddard launched the first liquid-fueled rocket.

questions.Question: When was the first train steamed off in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		On April 16,1853, the first passengers train steamed between Bori Bunder in Bombay and Thane.

questions.Question: After Uttar Pradesh, which among the following states has the maximum share in the total Route Kilometers of Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		After Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan has the maximum share in the total Route Kilometers of Indian Railways.

questions.Question: With which country did India sign the Joint Declaration of Intent (JDI) to strengthen the cooperation on strategic projects in the field of Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Union Cabinet chaired by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi was apprised of the Joint Declaration of Intent (JDI) between India and Germany regarding cooperation on strategic projects in the field of Railways.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the easternmost division of the Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lekhapani is a railway station on the Lumding-Dibrugarh section. It is located in Tinsukia district in the Indian state of Assam.

questions.Question: Who has been appointed as the new Union Minister of Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Piyush Goyal is the current Union Minister for Railways.

questions.Question: Which of the following has been declared the cleanest railway station in the A1 category, as per 2018 cleanliness survey for Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rajasthan's Jodhpur and Marwar railway stations are the cleanest on the Indian Railways network, says a 2018 survey by the national transporter.

questions.Question: Consider the following steps in Budget Procedure in India:1)The demands for grants of various ministries and departments including railways are considered by the concerned standing committees2)Broad contours of the budget and the principles and policies underlying it are discussed. 3)A cut motion is moved in the Lok Sabha 4)Budget is presented in the House.Which among the following is the correct sequence of the above steps?
questions.solution: Solution:		Budget is presented in the House, Broad contours of the budget and the principles and policies underlying it are discussed, The demands for grants of various ministries and departments including railways are considered by the concerned standing committees and A cut motion is moved in the Lok Sabha.

questions.Question: Who is the current director general of Railway Protection Force (RPF)?
questions.solution: Solution:		In September 2018, Senior IPS officer Arun Kumar was appointed as Director General of Railway Protection Force (RPF). Kumar, a 1985 batch officer of the Uttar Pradesh cadre, is serving as Special Director General of Border Security Force.

questions.Question: Which app has been launched by the Ministry of Railways to expedite & streamline passenger grievance redressal?
questions.solution: Solution:		In line with digital initiatives of Hon'ble PM, Indian Railways has for the first time completely digitized the Complaint management system. Shri Piyush Goyal, Minister of Railways & Coal today launched a new App “Rail Madad” – An App to expedite & streamline passenger grievance redressal.

questions.Question: How many stations to be redeveloped through PPP?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Railways is under huge pressure to put the process of redeveloping the Railway Stations on a fast track. Earlier, there was a proposal to develop 400 stations.However, after the re-categorisation of stations which was done earlier this year the number of stations that need to be redeveloped has escalated to 600.

questions.Question: In which city is the Wheel and Axle Plant of the Indian Railways located?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rail Wheel Factory, Yelehanka (RWF) (also known as Wheel and Axle Plant) is a manufacturing unit of Indian Railways, producing wheels, axles and wheel sets of railroad wagons, coaches and locomotives for the use of Indian Railways and overseas customers is situated at Yelahanka, Bangalore in the Indian state of Karnataka.

questions.Question: Which of the following ran the first train from Bori Bunder to Thane in 1853?
questions.solution: Solution:		On 16 April 1853, the Great Indian Peninsula Railway operated the first passenger train in India from Bori Bunder to Thane with 14 carriages and 400 passengers. The train which had three named locomotives, viz., Sindh, Sultan and Sahib, took off and embarked on an hour-and-fifteen-minute journey to Thane.

questions.Question: Where is the Railway Staff College located?
questions.solution: Solution:		The National Academy of Indian Railways, Vadodara formerly Railway Staff College is a Centralised Training Institute for Group A and B Officers of Indian Railways, headed by a Director General and manned by an faculty of experienced Railway Managers and Experts.

questions.Question: The railway station situated in the extreme south is
questions.solution: Solution:		The railway station situated in the extreme south is Kanyakumari.

questions.Question: When was the construction work for the first Railway line Started?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: How many institutions do give suggestions for railways technology?
questions.solution: Solution:		Two institutions do give suggestions for railways technology.

questions.Question: Indian Railway’s Jamalpur Workshop is located at?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railway’s Jamalpur Workshop is located at Bihar.

questions.Question: India's first rail auto hub will be located in:
questions.solution: Solution:		India's first rail-auto transportation and logistics hub will come up in Walajabad, near Chennai, Tamil Nadu.

questions.Question: Mountain Railways of India refer to the railway lines built in the mountains of India in the nineteenth and early twentieth century, during the British Raj, even being run today by the Indian Railways. How many railway lines refer to the Mountain Railways of India ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mountain Railways of India:(i)Darjeeling Himalayan Railways (DHR) - inscribed by UNESCO in 1999 :The Darjeeling Himalayan Railway consists of 88.48 kilometres of 2 feet (0.610 metre) gauge track that connects New Jalpaiguri with Darjeeling, passing through Ghoom at an altitude of 2,258 metres. The innovative design includes six zigzag reverses and three loops with a ruling gradient of 1:31. (ii) Nilgiri Mountain Railways (NMR) inscribed in 2005:This railway, scaling an elevation of 326 metre to 2,203 metre, represented the latest technology of the time and uses unique rack and pinion traction arrangement to negotiate steep gradient. (iii) Kalka Shimla Railway (KSR) inscribed in 2008: The world’s highest multi-arch gallery bridge and the world’s longest tunnel (at the time of construction) of KSR were the testimony of the brilliance engineering skills applied to make a dream a reality.

questions.Question: What is the position of the Indian Railway under one management are also credited with having a multi gauge and multi traction system?
questions.solution: Solution:		Second position

questions.Question: What is the name of the first train of Indian Railways handed over to private players for operation?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Delhi-Lucknow Tejas Express is set to be the first train to be operated by private players, sources said Monday, indicating that the Railways is going ahead with its 100-day agenda of handing over operations of two of its trains to the private sector, despite protests from its unions.

questions.Question: A platform surrounded by rail lines from all the four sides, is called
questions.solution: Solution:		A platform surrounded by rail lines from all the four sides, is called Island platform.

questions.Question: A station where the rail lines end, is called
questions.solution: Solution:		A "terminus" or "terminal" is a station at the end of a railway line.

questions.Question: The zone with the minimum length is
questions.solution: Solution:		The zone with the minimum length is North - Eastern Frontier Railway.

questions.Question: In which of the following cities is the National Rail Museum located ?
questions.solution: Solution:		National Rail Museum is located in New Delhi.

questions.Question: Kandaghat, a heritage railway station made entirely of wood and built by the British in 1903 was destroyed in the fire. In which state this Railway Station was located ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Shimla-Kalka rail line has been declared as heritage site by UNESCO. The railway station building was made entirely of wood by Britishers in 1903. In a major fire incident, the 108 year old heritage Kandaghat railway station in Solan district of Himachal Pradesh was gutted on Tuesday wee hours.

questions.Question: In which year Research, Design and Standard organization was established?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1957, the Central Standards Office (CSO) and the Railway Testing and Research Centre (RTRC) were integrated into a single unit named Research Designs and Standards Organisation (RDSO) under the Ministry of Railways with its headquarters at Manak Nagar, Lucknow.

questions.Question: When was the North - Eastern frontier Railway (NEFR) established?
questions.solution: Solution:		The North - Eastern frontier Railway (NEFR) wasestablished in 15th January, 1958.

questions.Question: When was the Central Railway established?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Central Railway was established 5th November, 1951.

questions.Question: At which of the following places Diesel Component Works is established?
questions.solution: Solution:		Diesel Component Works is established at Patiala.

questions.Question: Indian Railways has launched an integrated mobile app “Rail Saarthi” for railway passengers. What does “Saarthi” stands for?
questions.optionA: Synergised Advanced Application Rail Travel Help and Information
questions.optionB: Synchronic Advanced Application Rail Travel Help and Information
questions.optionC: Synchronous Advanced Application Rail Travel Help and Information
questions.optionD: Synergic Advanced Application Rail Travel Help and Information
questions.solution: Solution:		Synergised Advanced Application Rail Travel Help and Information

questions.Question: The manufacturing of steam engine in Chittranjan Locomotive Works was stopped in
questions.solution: Solution:		The production of steam and diesel locomotives were discontinued in 1972 and 1993 respectively.

questions.Question: New freight corridors announced at ________
questions.solution: Solution:		New freight corridors announced at Gujarat - Agra.

questions.Question: In context with the Indian railways what is TPWS?
questions.solution: Solution:		Train Protection Warning System

questions.Question: Where was the B.B.C.I locomotive started?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) certified ________ as India's first Eat Right Station.
questions.solution: Solution:		Mumbai Central gets India's first 'Eat Right Station', 4-star rating by FSSAI. MUMBAI : The Mumbai Central Terminus of the Western Railway has been certified as India's first "Eat Right Station" with a 4-Star rating awarded by the FSSAI.

questions.Question: Which train in India has the longest route length?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vivek Express – Dibrugarh to Kanyakumari. With a running time of 82 hours 45 minutes (3.5 days) and about 56 scheduled stops, the Vivek Express covers the longest train route in India. It originates in northern Assam and goes all the way to the southern tip of India to Kanyakumari.

questions.Question: Which of the following two countries have largest electrified railway network in the world?
questions.solution: Solution:		Russia & China are two countries that have largest electrified railway network in the world.

questions.Question: Launched three Trains to improve Quality of Travel (for reserved passengers), these are:
questions.solution: Solution:		Humsafar, Tejas and Uday.

questions.Question: Consider the following sectors:1)Plantation Sector2)Mining and Exploration of Metal 3)Railway InfrastructureIn which of the above, government has permitted 100% FDI through automatic route?
questions.solution: Solution:		All three.

questions.Question: Elphinstone Road suburban railway station which was recently renamed as Prabhadevi is situated in?
questions.solution: Solution:		Prabhadevi railway station. Prabhadevi railway station (formerly Elphinstone Road, station code: EPR), is a railway station on the Western line of the Mumbai Suburban Railway in Mumbai, India. It has two platforms, on which only slow trains halt. A footbridge links Prabhadevi to Parel station on the Central Line.

questions.Question: In diesel engine, ignition is caused by
questions.solution: Solution:		The diesel engine (also known as a compression-ignition or CI engine), named after Rudolf Diesel, is an internal combustion engine in which ignition of the fuel is caused by the elevated temperature of the air in the cylinder due to the mechanical compression (adiabatic compression).

questions.Question: Which of the following is India’s first green railway corridor?
questions.solution: Solution:		The nation's first Green Rail Corridor, a 114-km long Rameswaram-Manamadurai stretch in Tamil Nadu which ensures zero toilet discharge on rail tracks, was inaugurated by Railways Minister Suresh Prabhu.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the largest marshalling yard in India (also the longest in Asia)?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mughalsarai marshalling yard is the largest in Asia. It is 12.5 km long and handles around 1,500 wagons daily.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the largest railway junction in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		​​​​​​​Mathura junction is the largest railway junction in India, with as many as 7 routes emerging from this station. Mathura junction also has 10 platforms, with connectivity to all major cities of India.

questions.Question: How many training institutions of Railways are in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Five training institutions of Railways are in India.

questions.Question: At which of the following places steam engines were originally manufactured by Indian Railway ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Steam engines were originally manufactured by Indian Railway at Chittranjan.

questions.Question: Which year is declared as "Year of Rail Users" by the Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		1995 is declared as "Year of Rail Users" by the Indian Railways.

questions.Question: Who has been appointed the new Financial Commissioner (FC) of Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Shri A.K. Prasad has been appointed as new Financial Commissioner (Railways), Railway Board and ex-officio Secretary to Government of India vice Shri B.N. Mohapatra, who superannuated on 31st January, 2018.

questions.Question: Which of the following has been adjudged as the cleanest railway station in category A1, as per recently released report by the Ministry of Railways?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Which is the longest station name in Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Venkatanarasimharajuvaripeta is the Railway Station with the longest name in India.

questions.Question: First Train started in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first passenger train in India ran between Bombay (Bori Bunder) and Thane on 16 April 1853. The 14-carriage train was hauled by three steam locomotives: Sahib, Sindh and Sultan.

questions.Question: In which year the practice of presenting the railway budget separate from the general budget (or vice versa in true sense) started in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Separate Railway budget was introduced in 1924 on the recommendations of the Acworth committee. After 92 years in 2018 Railway Budget merged with General Budget was based on the recommendations of the Committee headed by Bibek Debroy, then a member of the NITI Aayog.

questions.Question: How much distance was travelled by first train of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		India's first train ran from Mumbai to Thane in 1853. The first train on the Indian sub-continent ran from Bori Bunder in Mumbai to Thane at 3.30 pm on April 16, 1853. The 14-carriage train carried 400 guests and covered a distance of 34 km.

questions.Question: In which Governor - General's reign railway lines in India were established?
questions.solution: Solution:		The country's first passenger train, which ran between Bombay's Bori Bunder station and Thane on 16 April 1853, was dedicated by Lord Dalhousie. Therefore, railway lines in India were established during Lord Dalhousie's reign.

questions.Question: What is the width of broad gauge railway line in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indian Railways has currently 4 different gauges. The Broad Gauge which is 1676 mm or 5 feet 6 inches

questions.Question: On which of the following is the longest railway bridge in India located?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Vembanad Rail Bridge is located in the state of Kerala and connects Edappally and Vallarpadam in Kochi. Vembanad rail bridge is the longest rail bridge in India with the total length of 4.62 km.

questions.Question: At what time the first train in Indian (and in Asia) flagged off?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first train in India (and Asia) ran over a short distance of 34 kilometres (21 miles) on 16 April 1853 between Bombay and Thane. Hauled by three engines — Sindh, Sahib and Sultan — the original train had fourteen coaches and 400 guests as passengers. It left Bombay at 3:35 pm and reached Thane in 57 minutes.

questions.Question: What is the position of the Indian Railway in the world according to the length of rail lines?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways is the 4th largest railway network in the world preceded by US (250, 000Km), China (100000Km), and Russia (85000Km).

questions.Question: When was Petrol Rail car started on Kalka - Shimla Rail route?
questions.solution: Solution:		Petrol Rail car started on Kalka - Shimla Rail route in 1911.

questions.Question: What is the position of the Indian Railway under the zonal system?
questions.solution: Solution:		The position of the Indian Railway under the zonal system is second.

questions.Question: Which of the following zones administers the Matheran Hill Railway?
questions.solution: Solution:		Matheran Hill Railway. The Matheran Hill Railway (MHR) is a 2 ft (610 mm) narrow-gauge heritage railway in Maharashtra, India, which is administered by the Central Railway.

questions.Question: Indian Railway will be provided a device to their Gang Men which would be wireless enabled and will intimate them about approaching trains. The Device will be called:
questions.solution: Solution:		Railway Minister announced that all our gang men will be provided with devices called 'Rakshak' which would be wireless enabled and will intimate them about approaching trains. Indian Railways will also reduce the weight of the tools carried by them while patrolling on foot through value engineering.

questions.Question: Which of the gauges is used in the hilly areas?
questions.solution: Solution:		Narrow gauge is used in the hilly areas.

questions.Question: The first Shatabdi express was introduced between which of the following locations?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first Shatabdi Express train was introduced in 1988, by then Railways Minister Madhavrao Scindia to commemorate the birth centenary of Jawaharlal Nehru the first Prime Minister of India, between New Delhi and Jhansi Junction.

questions.Question: Through which of the following group of states does the Konkan Railways run?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 741-km (461-mi) line connects the states of Maharashtra, Goa and Karnataka.

questions.Question: Who of the following is known for having designed the first railway timetables?
questions.solution: Solution:		George Bradshaw is known for having designed the first railway timetables.

questions.Question: In which institution the training of electric work is being given?
questions.optionA: Indian Railways Institute of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering
questions.optionB: Indian Railways Institute of Electrical Engineering
questions.optionD: Indian Railways Institute of Civil Engineering
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways Institute of Electrical Engineering (IRIEEN), Nashik was set up by the Indian Railways at Nashik in Maharashtra for imparting training to newly appointed officers of Indian Railway Service of Electrical Engineers (IRSEE), recruited through Engineering Services Examination conducted by UPSC, New Delhi.

questions.Question: In which year Indian Railway was nationalized?
questions.solution: Solution:		Railways were first introduced to India in 1853. By 1947, the year of India's independence, there were forty-two rail systems. In 1951 the systems were nationalised as one unit, becoming one of the largest networks in the world.

questions.Question: Railway Staff College is situated at
questions.solution: Solution:		Railway Staff College (now called as National Academy of Indian Railways) is a centralised training institute for Group A and Group B officers of Indian Railways located in Lalbaug-Manjalpur area of Vadodara (Gujarat).

questions.Question: Consider the following statements with respect to Railway Freight corridor projects in India:1)The Eastern freight corridor extends from Dankuni in Bengal to Ludhiana in Punjab and it is funded by World Bank2)The Western freight corridor extends from Jawaharlal Nehru port in Mumbai to Dadri near Delhi and it is funded by Japan International Cooperation AgencyWhich of the above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Eastern freight corridor extends from Dankuni in Bengal to Ludhiana in Punjab and it is funded by World Bank and the Western freight corridor extends from Jawaharlal Nehru port in Mumbai to Dadri near Delhi and it is funded by Japan International Cooperation Agency.

questions.Question: Which of the following committee gave recommendations on separation of Policy - making, Regulation & Operations in Indian Railways and setting up of a Railway Regulatory Authority of India (RRAI)?
questions.solution: Solution:		The committee chaired by Bibek Debroy had inter-alia recommended concessioning of commercial operation of train service like Rajdhani/Shatabdi to private parties.

questions.Question: Presentation of the first ever railway budget in India held in
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Consider the following statements about the Railway Convention Committee:1)It consists of members from Lok Sabha only2)Chairman of Railway Convention Committee is appointed by Lok Sabha speakerWhich among the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chairman of Railway Convention Committee is appointed by Lok Sabha speaker.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements about the Railwire Saathi project:1)It is an initiative by the Indian Railway Stations Development Corporation Limited (IRSDC)2)It aims to provide railway stations in India with high - speed public Wi - Fi serviceWhich of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		It aims to provide railway stations in India with high - speed public Wi - Fi service.

questions.Question: The world’s highest railway bridge will come up over which Indian River?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Chenab Bridge is an Indian railway steel and concrete arch bridge under construction between Bakkal and Kauri in the Reasi district of Jammu and Kashmir in India. When completed, the bridge will span the Chenab River at a height of 359 m (1,178 ft) above the river, making it the world's highest rail bridge.

questions.Question: Which railway zone has become the first Rail Zone in India with 100% LED Lighting at railway stations?
questions.solution: Solution:		The South Central Railway (SCR) has become the first railway zone in India to complete 100% LED lighting at all the 733 stations under its jurisdiction.

questions.Question: Which of the following stations was formerly known as Victoria Terminus?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (officially Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus) (station code: CSTM (mainline)/ST (suburban)), also known by its former name Victoria Terminus (station code: BBVT/VT), is a historic terminal train station and UNESCO World Heritage Site in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.

questions.Question: 2 states of North East India will be connected through Broad Gauge. They are:
questions.solution: Solution:		Mizoram and Manipur will be connected through Broad Gauge.

questions.Question: When was the first underground railway (Metro Railway) started?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Kolkata Metro was the first metro railway in India, opening for commercial services from 1984.

questions.Question: On November 14, 2019, With which locomotive factory, Indian Railways & French multinational company Alstom have entered into procurement cum maintenance agreement to deliver the 10 locomotives in FY (fiscal year) 2019 - 20?
questions.solution: Solution:		On November 14, 2019, to deliver the 10 locomotives in FY (fiscal year) 2019-20, Indian Railways & French multinational company Alstom have entered into procurement cum maintenance agreement with Bihar based Madhepura Electric Locomotive Pvt. Ltd.

questions.Question: Where is the Research, Design and Standard Organisation situated?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1957, the Central Standards Office (CSO) and the Railway Testing and Research Centre (RTRC) were integrated into a single unit named Research Designs and Standards Organisation (RDSO) under the Ministry of Railways with its headquarters at Manak Nagar, Lucknow.

questions.Question: Where is the wheel and axle plant of Indian Railways situated?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rail Wheel Factory, Yelehanka (RWF) (also known as Wheel and Axle Plant) is a manufacturing unit of Indian Railways, producing wheels, axles and wheel sets of railroad wagons, coaches and locomotives for the use of Indian Railways and overseas customers is situated at Yelahanka, Bangalore in the Indian state of Karnataka.

questions.Question: Where is the Indian Railways Institute of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering institute situated?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indian Railways Institute of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (IRIMEE), was founded in 1888 as a technical school and commenced training Mechanical Officers for Indian Railways in 1927. It is the oldest of the five Centralised Training Institutes (CTIs) for training officers for Indian Railways. IRIMEE is located at Jamalpur in the Munger district of Bihar, on the Patna-Bhagalpur rail route.

questions.Question: Where is the Indian Railways Institute of Civil Engineering Institute situated?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways Institute of Civil Engineering (IRICEN), Pune is the training institute for the Civil engineers of the Indian Railways.

questions.Question: India’s first Antyodaya Express has been launched by the Minister of Railways. The express will run between which stations?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Union Minister of Railways Suresh Prabhu has flagged off India’s first Antyodaya Express between Ernakulam and Howrah. The train service was inaugurated by the Railways Minister via video conferencing in New Delhi on February 27, 2017. The Antyodaya Express is a long-distance, fully unreserved, superfast train service, for the common man to be operated on dense routes. The new express train will have facilities like cushioned luggage racks which can serve as seats, LED lights, modular toilets, pleasing interior colour scheme and others. Beside this, the Railway Minister has also flagged off the 4th Humsafar Express between Sriganganagar and Tiruchirapalli. The new train is fully air-conditioned third AC service with an optional service for meals.

questions.Question: Consider the following statements about Railway Convention Committee:1)The Chairman of the Committee is appointed by the Speaker from amongst the members of the Committee2) The Committee reviews the rate of dividend which is payable by the Railway Undertaking to the General RevenuesWhich of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Chairman of the Committee is appointed by the Speaker from amongst the members of the Committee and The Committee reviews the rate of dividend which is payable by the Railway Undertaking to the General Revenues.

questions.Question: What was the main source of earning of Railway?
questions.solution: Solution:		Freight is one of the major sources of income for Indian Railways.

questions.Question: Which of the following has become the India’s first railway station to have sanitary napkin vending machine?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Bhopal railway station has become the India's first railway station to have a sanitary napkin vending machine named as 'Happy Nari'. The machine dispenses two sanitary napkins at the cost of Rs 5 only and accepts Rs 5 coins.

questions.Question: Indian Railway will publish new Magazine in all regional language. The name of that Magazine is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The railway magazine, Rail Bandhu, will be now published in all regional languages and would be available for purchase to reserved passengers.

questions.Question: Seikan Tunnel which is a Railway tunnel with less than half length under seabed is located in which country?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 53.85km Seikan tunnel in Japan is the longest and deepest rail tunnel in the world. It passes through Tsugaru Strait connecting the Hokkaido and Honshu islands. It was built 100m below the seabed and includes a 23.3km submarine portion.

questions.Question: Which railway station entered Limca Book of Records 2018 for having all - women staff?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Matunga suburban station on the Central Railway (CR) of Mumbai division has figured in the Limca Book of Records 2018 for having an all-woman staff. The achievement comes six months after Matunga became the first railway station in the country to be run by an all-woman staff.

questions.Question: Which railway station has become the India’s first station to run by all women staff?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Matunga suburban station on the Central Railway (CR) of Mumbai division has figured in the Limca Book of Records 2018 for having an all-woman staff. The achievement comes six months after Matunga became the first railway station in the country to be run by an all-woman staff.

questions.Question: In how many zones Indian Railway has been divided?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways is divided into 17 zones, which are further sub-divided into divisions. The number of zones in Indian Railways increased from six to eight in 1951, nine in 1966 and sixteen in 2003. Each zonal railway is made up of a certain number of divisions, each having a divisional headquarters.

questions.Question: When was the Jammu City appeared on the map of Indian Railway?
questions.solution: Solution:		Jammu City appeared on the map of Indian Railway in 1965.

questions.Question: Which of the following stations has all the three gauges viz. broad, metre and narrow?
questions.solution: Solution:		Siliguri Junction is one of the three railway stations that serves the city of Siliguri located in Darjeeling district in the Indian state of West Bengal. The other two stations are: Siliguri Town and New Jalpaiguri. It has 1,676 mm (5 ft 6 in) broad gauge and Narrow Gauge tracks. It formerly had the distinction of having three gauges but the metre-gauge line from Aluabari Road to Siliguri Junction was converted later into broad gauge. Few years ago train bus used to run between Siliguri Junction to naksalbari by the metre gauge line.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the headquarters of the newly established railway zone 'East Coast Railways'?
questions.solution: Solution:		The East Coast Railway (abbreviated ECoR) is one of the 18 railway zones of Indian Railways. It came into existence on 1 April 2003. The headquarters of the zone are at Bhubaneswar.

questions.Question: Headquarters of which one among the following Railway Zones in India is situated at the highest elevation from the mean sea level?
questions.solution: Solution:		Headquarters of South Western Railway is situated at the highest elevation from the mean sea level.

questions.Question: With reference to headquarters of the various Railway zones, consider the following matches:North Eastern → Guwahati Central → Bhopal Western → MumbaiWhich of the above is / are correct matches:
questions.solution: Solution:		Western → Mumbai is correct.

questions.Question: The headquarter of Central Railway situated at?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mumbai (CST) is the headquarter of Central Railway.

questions.Question: The monies in the National Investment Fund can be used for ________:1. Recapitalization of public sector banks2. Purchasing the shares of CPSEs3. Towards operating expenses of Indian Railways4. Social Overheads such as building schools, toilets etc.Select the correct option from the codes given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		The monies in the National Investment Fund can be used for recapitalization of public sector banks and purchasing the shares of CPSEs.

questions.Question: The Mughalsarai junction has recently renamed as Deen Dayal Upadhyaya railway station. It is located in which state?
questions.solution: Solution:		Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction, station code: DDU, formerly MGS), is a railway station in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. The station contains the largest railway marshaling yard in Asia. Mughalsarai yard cater to around 450-500 trains in a month.

questions.Question: Matheran Hill Railway is a narrow gauge heritage railway located in which state?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Matheran Hill Railway (MHR) is a 2 ft (610 mm) narrow-gauge heritage railway in Maharashtra, India, which is administered by the Central Railway. It covers a distance of 21 km (13 mi), cutting a swathe through forest and connecting Neral to Matheran in the Western Ghats.

questions.Question: Indian railways has installed Asia’s largest Solid State Interlocking (SSI) system in which state?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways has installed Asia's largest Solid State Interlocking (SSI) system at Kharagpur in West Bengal. The system will enable station masters to set 800 different routes for trains in a matter of minutes.

questions.Question: Which city is hosting the International Conference on Green Initiatives & Railway Electrification?
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Conference on Green Initiatives & Railway Electrification was hosted in New Delhi.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the largest zone in terms of route kilometers?
questions.solution: Solution:		Northern Railway zone is the Answer. Its headquarter is New Delhi Railway Station. Northern Railways is one of nine old zones of Indian Railways and also the biggest in terms of network having 6807 kilometre route.

questions.Question: Shatabdi Express train was started in ________.
questions.solution: Solution:		The first Shatabdi Express train was introduced in 1988, by then Railways Minister Madhavrao Scindia to commemorate the birth centenary of Jawaharlal Nehru the first Prime Minister of India, between New Delhi and Jhansi Junction.

questions.Question: Which is the shortest station name in Indian Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ib is a railway station in the Indian state of Odisha. It has the distinction of having the shortest name of all stations on the Indian Railways system.

questions.Question: A separate Railway Budget, which is different from the General Budget, was first introduced in 1924 on the basis of recommendations of the 10 - member:
questions.solution: Solution:		A separate Railway Budget, which is different from the General Budget, was first introduced in 1924 on the basis of recommendations of the 10-member Acworth Committee.

questions.Question: The shuttle train service between Lahore and ________ railway station resumed its operation on 15 December after a gap of 22 years.
questions.solution: Solution:		The shuttle train service between Lahore and Wagah railway station resumed operation on Sunday after a gap of 22 years.

questions.Question: Diesel locomotives are built in?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Diesel Locomotive Works (DLW) in Varanasi, India, is a production unit of Indian Railways, that manufactures diesel-electric locomotives and its spare parts.

questions.Question: In which of the following cities, the first subway train was started?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Kolkata Metro was the first metro railway in India, opening for commercial services from 1984.

questions.Question: Between which of the destinations the first Indian train was started?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first passenger train in India ran between Bombay (Bori Bunder) and Thane on 16 April 1853.

questions.Question: Consider the following:1)Real Estate Investment Trust2)Railway operation3)Atomic EnergyAs of now, there is no FDI in India, in which of above sector(s)?
questions.solution: Solution:		All three

questions.Question: Is general manager responsible for?
questions.optionC: Both railway Board and Railway Ministry
questions.solution: Solution:		Railway Board.

questions.Question: Where is the wheel and axle plant of Indian Railways situated ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rail Wheel Factory, Yelehanka (RWF) (also known as Wheel and Axle Plant) is a manufacturing unit of Indian Railways, producing wheels, axles and wheel sets of railroad wagons, coaches and locomotives for the use of Indian Railways and overseas customers is situated at Yelahanka, Bangalore in the Indian state of Karnataka.

questions.Question: Indian Railways which is the largest of the Public Sector Enterprises, is divided in how many regions?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways which is the largest of the Public Sector Enterprises, is divided in 9 regions.

questions.Question: Where is the extreme north of India a railway station?
questions.solution: Solution:		India's northernmost railway station is Baramulla in Jammu and Kashmir, and the westernmost is Naliya near Gujarat's Bhuj. Kanyakumari is the last railway station in the south, while on the east, it is Ledo on branch line from Tinsukia.

questions.Question: Which state to have India’s first privately - run railway station?
questions.solution: Solution:		It's in Bhopal. This is the rendered site-image of Habibganj railway station in Bhopal. This will be the first station in the country to be developed under private partnership. Indian Railway Stations Development Corporation has announced that Habibganj station will be developed according to international standards.

questions.Question: India’s first solar - powered 1600 HP DEMU train has launched from which railway station?
questions.solution: Solution:		India's first 1600 HP solar-powered DEMU train was launched from Safdarjung railway station. It will run from Sarai Rohilla in Delhi to Farukh Nagar in Haryana.

questions.Question: Which of the following will become the first central paramilitary force to opt for e - ticketing instead of Railway warrant?
questions.solution: Solution:		The National Security Guard will be the first central paramilitary force to opt for e-ticketing instead of the railway warrant under an agreement signed with the IRCTC, a statement from the catering and tourism arm of the railways said today.
